intro: Schimmelia, commonly known as the "cushion plant," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. These plants are typically small, mat-forming species that thrive in rocky or alpine environments. Schimmelia species are characterized by their compact growth habit, with dense clusters of leaves that form a cushion-like structure. They produce small, often pink or white flowers that bloom in the summer months. Due to their specialized habitat requirements, many Schimmelia species are rare and are of interest to botanists and conservationists.
